thread.title: Screening to highlight pioneering women in Episcopal Church | Entertainment | bakersfield.com
thread.title_full: Screening to highlight pioneering women in Episcopal Church | Entertainment | bakersfield.com

author: REV. SUZANNE WARD For The Californian
title: Screening to highlight pioneering women in Episcopal Church | Entertainment | bakersfield.com
text:
Fifty years ago this June, in an act of civil disobedience, 11 women were ordained as Episcopal priests. Known thereafter as the Philadelphia 11 as their ordination had occurred at the Church of the Advocate in Philadelphia, these women were harassed, threatened and banned from stepping on church property.
On June 15, St. Paul's Episcopal Church will present a screening of the documentary "The Philadelphia Eleven" followed by a discussion about the impact these women had on the Episcopal Church. (The Episcopal Diocese of San Joaquin was one of the last dioceses to ordain women, holding out until 2009.)
